content:
Add a Radio Input Element to a FlexCard

Add a Radio input element on a FlexCard to enable users to select an item from one or more options. Configure properties and custom attributes, add an action, and add conditions.

Available beginning Winter '22.

From the FlexCards tab, click a version of a FlexCard to open the FlexCard Designer.
From the Build panel, click Inputs, and drag the Radio element onto the canvas.
Configure properties common to all Input elements:

In Field Binding, bind the value of the input element to an existing or new data field. See Bind a FlexCard Input Value to a Data Field.

In Field Label, enter the label that appears next to the element.

Check Required if the user must enter or select a value for this input element.

Check Read-only to disable the ability to modify the input values.

In Help Text, enter helpful text about the purpose of the input field.

Select the Display Mode for your radio items. Available modes are:

Vertical
Horizontal
Button Group
Image
Color

If Display Mode is Image or Color, configure the following properties:

Width and Height: Set the width and height of the image or circle in pixels.
Enable Caption (for Image mode) or Count Per Row (for Color mode): Configure as needed.

To enter the options from which the user can select, click + Add New in the Options section. Configure Label, Value, and Use As a Default Value for each option.

(Optional) To configure additional properties available to the element, click + Add New in the Custom Attributes section.

To execute an action when a user interacts with the input element, click + Add Action.
(Optional) To add conditions that must be met for the element to display, see Add Conditions to a FlexCard Element.
(Optional) To style your element, click Style to open the Style panel.
title: Add a Radio Input Element to a FlexCard
